'''
    Create a function that returns True if the last character
    of a given string is an alphabetical character and is not
    a part of a word, and False otherwise.
    Note: "word" is a group of characters separated by space.

    Examples:
    check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pie") â False
    check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e") â True
    check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e ") â False
    check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("") â False 
    '''

    # Split the string into words
    words = txt.split()

    # Check if the last character of the last word is an alphabetical character
    if words[-1][-1].isalpha():
        # Check if the last character is not a part of a word
        if not any(word.endswith(words[-1][-1]) for word in words[:-1]):
            return True
    return False
